screen_design_ref: Figure 39.1: Introduction Page Load and Navigation
description: Verify that the Blue Team vs Red Team introduction page loads correctly with all content sections
scenario: User navigates to Blue vs Red Team mode introduction page to learn about the simulation
expected_results: Introduction page displays with hero section, team comparison, scenario overview, and navigation buttons
procedure:
1. Log in as authenticated user
2. Navigate to /blue-vs-red/
3. Verify page loads with gradient background and cyber grid
4. Check hero section displays title and description
5. Confirm 'Start Simulation' and 'Tutorial' buttons are present
6. Verify team comparison cards are displayed
7. Check floating orbs animation is active

description: Verify interactive elements and animations work correctly on the introduction page
scenario: User interacts with various elements on the introduction page to explore features
expected_results: Hover effects, animations, and button interactions work smoothly with visual feedback
procedure:
1. Load introduction page
2. Hover over feature cards and verify hover effects
3. Test keyboard navigation with Enter key
4. Verify gradient shift animation is running
5. Check floating orbs animation cycles properly
6. Test button hover states and transitions
7. Verify notification system displays feedback messages

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.3: Tutorial Page Content and Navigation
description: Verify the tutorial page displays comprehensive educational content about Blue vs Red Team concepts
scenario: User accesses tutorial to learn about Blue Team defense and Red Team attack methodologies
expected_results: Tutorial page shows team comparisons, scenario details, features overview, and tips section
procedure:
1. Navigate to /blue-vs-red/tutorial
2. Verify tutorial page loads with proper styling
3. Check team comparison section displays Blue vs Red team roles
4. Confirm scenario section explains Project Sentinel Academy context
5. Verify features section covers AI engine, real-time monitoring, and defense tools
6. Check tips section provides strategic guidance
7. Confirm 'Ready to Start' section with navigation buttons

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.4: Tutorial to Dashboard Navigation Flow
description: Verify navigation flow from tutorial to dashboard works correctly with next parameter handling
scenario: User completes tutorial and proceeds to dashboard simulation with proper parameter forwarding
expected_results: Tutorial completion redirects to dashboard when next=dashboard parameter is present
procedure:
1. Navigate to /blue-vs-red/tutorial?next=dashboard
2. Complete tutorial interactions
3. Click 'Start Dashboard' button
4. Verify redirection to /blue-vs-red/dashboard
5. Check tutorial completion state is tracked
6. Confirm dashboard loads with proper initialization
7. Test direct navigation without next parameter

description: Verify the dashboard loads correctly with all simulation components and proper layout
scenario: User accesses the main simulation dashboard to begin Blue vs Red Team training
expected_results: Dashboard displays with network map, alert center, AI analysis, incident response, and terminal sections
procedure:
1. Navigate to /blue-vs-red/dashboard
2. Verify dashboard loads with dark theme styling
3. Check Network Defense Map section is present
4. Confirm Alert Center displays with counter
5. Verify AI Threat Analysis panel is visible
6. Check Incident Response section is available
7. Confirm Defense Command Terminal is displayed
8. Verify game controls menu is accessible

description: Verify the Game Controller initializes correctly with proper game state and component integration
scenario: Game Controller orchestrates the simulation by initializing AI engine, UI manager, and game state
expected_results: Game Controller successfully initializes all components with default secure state
procedure:
1. Load dashboard page
2. Verify Game Controller initialization message in console
3. Check default game state: isRunning=false, timeRemaining=900
4. Confirm assets initialized as secure with 100% integrity
5. Verify security controls are active (firewall, endpoint, access)
6. Check AI Engine and UI Manager initialization
7. Confirm terminal displays welcome messages

description: Verify the AI Engine implements Q-Learning algorithm correctly for adaptive Red Team attacks
scenario: AI Engine uses Q-Learning to adapt attack strategies based on Blue Team defensive responses
expected_results: AI Engine maintains Q-table, selects actions using exploration/exploitation, and updates based on success/failure
procedure:
1. Start simulation to activate AI Engine
2. Verify Q-Learning parameters initialization (learning rate, discount factor, exploration rate)
3. Check Q-table creation and state-action mapping
4. Confirm attack type selection based on MITRE ATT&CK framework
5. Verify reward calculation based on attack success/detection
6. Check exploration rate decay over time
7. Confirm Q-table updates after each attack attempt

description: Verify AI system dynamically adjusts difficulty within a single session
scenario: AI Engine adapts attack intensity and tactics based on real-time player performance during the Blue Team vs Red Team simulation
expected_results: AI increases or decreases attack frequency and complexity in response to player performance, ensuring balanced challenge without external adaptive learning integration
procedure:
1. Initialize simulation with AI Engine
2. Start simulation and engage in defensive actions
3. Observe AI adapting attack frequency based on successful/failed defenses
4. Verify AI introduces more complex tactics when defenses are consistently effective
5. Confirm AI reduces pressure when defenses repeatedly fail
6. Ensure AI difficulty adjustments remain within acceptable challenge boundaries
7. Check AI adaptive behavior resets between new sessions (no carry-over learning)

description: Verify game state management handles start, pause, stop, and reset operations correctly
scenario: Game Controller manages simulation lifecycle through various game states and transitions
expected_results: Game state transitions work correctly with proper UI updates and component synchronization
procedure:
1. Verify initial game state (not running)
2. Start simulation and check state transition to running
3. Confirm timer starts and AI attack sequence begins
4. Pause simulation and verify timer stops
5. Resume simulation and check timer continues
6. Stop simulation and verify state reset
7. Reset simulation and confirm all components return to initial state

description: Verify the network defense map displays assets correctly with real-time status updates
scenario: Network map visualizes Project Sentinel Academy infrastructure with dynamic asset status indicators
expected_results: Network map shows assets with color-coded status, integrity bars, and real-time updates during attacks
procedure:
1. Load dashboard and verify network map display
2. Check initial asset status (all secure with green indicators)
3. Start simulation and monitor asset status changes
4. Verify color coding: green (secure), orange (vulnerable), red (compromised)
5. Check integrity percentage updates in real-time
6. Confirm asset hover effects and interactive elements
7. Verify network connection lines between assets

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.11: Alert Center and Notification System
description: Verify the alert center displays security alerts with proper severity classification and real-time updates
scenario: Alert center receives and displays security alerts from AI attacks with appropriate severity levels
expected_results: Alert center shows alerts with severity badges, timestamps, and dynamic counter updates
procedure:
1. Start simulation to generate alerts
2. Verify alert display with severity classification (low, medium, high, critical)
3. Check alert counter updates dynamically
4. Confirm timestamp display for each alert
5. Verify severity color coding (green, yellow, orange, red)
6. Check alert scrolling and overflow handling
7. Test alert acknowledgment and status updates

description: Verify the Defense Command Terminal accepts commands and provides interactive Blue Team defense capabilities
scenario: Blue Team defender uses terminal commands to analyze threats, implement defenses, and respond to incidents
expected_results: Terminal accepts commands, displays help information, executes defensive actions, and provides feedback
procedure:
1. Access Defense Command Terminal in dashboard
2. Type 'help' command and verify available commands list
3. Execute 'status' command to view system status
4. Run 'assets' command to display asset information
5. Test 'scan' command for security scanning
6. Execute 'block [IP]' command for IP blocking
7. Verify terminal scrolling and command history

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.13: AI Attack Execution and Detection
description: Verify AI attacks are executed correctly with proper detection mechanisms and impact assessment
scenario: AI engine launches various attack types against assets with realistic detection probabilities
expected_results: AI attacks target assets, trigger alerts when detected, and impact asset integrity appropriately
procedure:
1. Start simulation to enable AI attacks
2. Monitor AI attack execution in console logs
3. Verify different attack types (reconnaissance, lateral movement, exfiltration)
4. Check detection probability calculations
5. Confirm alert generation for detected attacks
6. Verify asset integrity decreases for successful attacks
7. Check attack success/failure feedback to Q-Learning system

description: Verify security controls can be toggled and affect attack success rates appropriately
scenario: Blue Team manages security controls (firewall, endpoint protection, access control) to improve defenses
expected_results: Security controls toggle correctly and influence AI attack effectiveness and detection rates
procedure:
1. Access security controls panel in dashboard
2. Verify initial control states (all active)
3. Toggle firewall control and check status update
4. Disable endpoint protection and monitor attack success changes
5. Toggle access control and verify impact on lateral movement
6. Check visual indicators update (green/red status)
7. Confirm effectiveness percentages are displayed

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.15: Real-time Timer and Game Duration
description: Verify the simulation timer counts down correctly and triggers game end conditions
scenario: Timer manages simulation duration with visual countdown and automatic game termination
expected_results: Timer displays correctly, counts down from 15 minutes, and ends game when reaching zero
procedure:
1. Start simulation and verify timer begins at 15:00
2. Check timer counts down in real-time (seconds)
3. Pause simulation and verify timer stops
4. Resume and confirm timer continues from paused point
5. Monitor timer display format (MM:SS)
6. Wait for timer to reach low values and check warning states
7. Verify game ends automatically when timer reaches 0:00

description: Verify incident response system logs and tracks security incidents with proper categorization
scenario: System records security incidents from AI attacks and provides incident management capabilities
expected_results: Incidents are logged with timestamps, severity, affected assets, and response options
procedure:
1. Start simulation to generate incidents
2. Verify incident logging for AI attacks
3. Check incident categorization by type and severity
4. Confirm timestamp accuracy for incident records
5. Verify affected asset identification in incidents
6. Check incident response options availability
7. Test incident resolution and status updates

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.17: Player Action Recording and Analytics
description: Verify player actions are recorded correctly for performance analysis
scenario: System tracks player defensive actions and response times for scoring and feedback
expected_results: Player actions are logged with timestamps and contribute to final performance scoring
procedure:
1. Perform various defensive actions during simulation
2. Verify action recording in game system
3. Check response time measurement accuracy
4. Confirm action effectiveness tracking
5. Verify defensive action logging
6. Check performance score calculation
7. Confirm action data contributes to final results

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.18: Game Results and Scoring System
description: Verify game completion generates accurate results with comprehensive scoring metrics
scenario: Game end calculates final score based on asset integrity, detection rate, and response effectiveness
expected_results: Game results display final score, performance breakdown, asset status summary, and recommendations
procedure:
1. Complete a full simulation session
2. Verify game over modal displays results
3. Check final score calculation components
4. Confirm asset integrity percentage in results
5. Verify detection rate calculation accuracy
6. Check average response time metrics
7. Confirm performance recommendations are provided

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.19: API Endpoints and State Management
description: Verify backend API endpoints handle game state operations correctly
scenario: Frontend communicates with backend APIs for game state management, session tracking, and result storage
expected_results: API endpoints respond correctly to game state requests and maintain session integrity
procedure:
1. Test GET /blue-vs-red/api/game-state endpoint
2. Verify POST /blue-vs-red/api/game-state updates state
3. Check POST /blue-vs-red/api/start-game starts session
4. Test POST /blue-vs-red/api/stop-game ends session
5. Verify POST /blue-vs-red/api/reset-game resets state
6. Check player and AI action logging endpoints
7. Test game results retrieval endpoint

description: Verify proper error handling when simulation encounters issues or invalid states
scenario: System handles various error conditions gracefully during simulation operations
expected_results: Appropriate error messages display and recovery options are provided for operation failures
procedure:
1. Test invalid API requests and verify error responses
2. Simulate network disconnection during game session
3. Test invalid terminal commands and error messaging
4. Verify handling of corrupted game state
5. Check error display for failed AI operations
6. Test recovery from browser refresh during active session
7. Verify error logging and user feedback systems

description: Verify simulation maintains performance during intensive AI operations and real-time updates
scenario: System performance remains stable during high-frequency AI attacks and UI updates
expected_results: Smooth performance during intensive simulation with responsive user interface
procedure:
1. Start simulation with maximum AI attack frequency
2. Monitor CPU and memory usage during operation
3. Check UI responsiveness during rapid alert generation
4. Verify smooth animations and transitions under load
5. Test terminal responsiveness with rapid command input
6. Check network map updates during multiple simultaneous attacks
7. Verify timer accuracy under processing load

description: Verify UI Manager correctly updates all interface elements in real-time during simulation
scenario: UI Manager coordinates updates across all dashboard components based on game state changes
expected_results: All UI elements update synchronously and accurately reflect current game state
procedure:
1. Start simulation and monitor UI update coordination
2. Verify system status indicators update correctly
3. Check asset status visualization updates
4. Confirm alert center updates in real-time
5. Verify security controls reflect current state
6. Check timer display updates smoothly
7. Confirm terminal output updates properly

description: Verify simulation state persistence across browser sessions and page refreshes
scenario: Game state is maintained and recoverable during browser navigation and session interruptions
expected_results: Session state persists across page refreshes and browser restarts with proper recovery mechanisms
procedure:
1. Start simulation and progress through several attacks
2. Refresh browser page and verify state recovery
3. Navigate away and return to verify session persistence
4. Close browser and reopen to test session restoration
5. Check localStorage state management
6. Verify proper cleanup on session end
7. Test multiple browser tab handling

description: Verify educational feedback system provides appropriate guidance and learning support
scenario: System provides contextual hints, explanations, and learning feedback during simulation
expected_results: Educational content helps users understand cybersecurity concepts and improve defensive skills
procedure:
1. Perform defensive actions and verify feedback messages
2. Check hint system availability and relevance
3. Verify educational explanations for attack types
4. Confirm defensive strategy recommendations
5. Check progress feedback and skill development tracking
6. Verify contextual help for terminal commands
7. Test feedback system provides appropriate guidance

description: Verify Blue Team vs Red Team mode works correctly across different web browsers
scenario: Simulation functions properly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers
expected_results: Consistent functionality and appearance across major web browsers
procedure:
1. Test simulation in Google Chrome
2. Verify functionality in Mozilla Firefox
3. Check compatibility with Safari (if available)
4. Test in Microsoft Edge browser
5. Confirm JavaScript module loading works across browsers
6. Verify CSS animations and transitions
7. Check localStorage functionality across browsers

description: Verify Blue Team vs Red Team interface meets accessibility standards for screen readers and keyboard navigation
scenario: Simulation interface is accessible to users with disabilities through proper accessibility features
expected_results: Interface supports keyboard navigation, screen readers, and accessibility standards
procedure:
1. Navigate interface using only keyboard
2. Test with screen reader for proper content reading
3. Verify focus indicators on interactive elements
4. Check proper ARIA labels for complex components
5. Test modal accessibility and focus management
6. Verify color contrast meets accessibility standards
7. Check alternative text for visual elements

description: Verify security measures protect against client-side vulnerabilities and data exposure
scenario: Simulation implements proper security controls to protect user data and prevent exploitation
expected_results: Security controls prevent XSS, CSRF, and unauthorized data access
procedure:
1. Test input validation in terminal commands
2. Verify XSS protection in alert messages
3. Check CSRF protection on API endpoints
4. Test authorization for game state access
5. Verify secure session management
6. Check for data exposure in browser tools
7. Test API rate limiting and abuse prevention

description: Verify Blue Team vs Red Team interface adapts properly to mobile devices and smaller screens
scenario: Interface remains functional and usable on tablets and mobile devices with responsive design
expected_results: Interface adapts to smaller screens maintaining usability and core functionality
procedure:
1. Test interface on tablet screen sizes (768px-1024px)
2. Check mobile phone compatibility (320px-768px)
3. Verify touch interaction compatibility
4. Check text readability at different scales
5. Verify button and interactive element sizing
6. Test navigation and menu accessibility on mobile
7. Check terminal usability on touch devices

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.29: Integration with Main CyberQuest System
description: Verify Blue Team vs Red Team mode integrates properly with main CyberQuest platform
scenario: Mode integrates seamlessly with user authentication, progress tracking, and navigation system
expected_results: Proper integration with authentication, navbar, user progress, and platform navigation
procedure:
1. Verify authentication requirements for mode access
2. Check user session management integration
3. Test navigation integration with main platform
4. Verify progress tracking and analytics integration
5. Check logout functionality and session cleanup
6. Test breadcrumb navigation and back buttons
7. Verify consistent styling with platform theme

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.30: Complete Blue vs Red Team Workflow
description: Verify complete end-to-end workflow from introduction through simulation completion with comprehensive cybersecurity training
scenario: User experiences complete Blue Team vs Red Team training from introduction to advanced simulation mastery
expected_results: Complete workflow provides engaging cybersecurity education covering defensive strategies, incident response, and real-time threat analysis
procedure:
1. Access Blue Team vs Red Team introduction page
2. Review team comparison and scenario overview
3. Navigate through comprehensive tutorial covering defensive concepts
4. Launch main simulation dashboard with all components
5. Experience AI-driven attacks using Q-Learning adaptive system
6. Use Defense Command Terminal for incident response
7. Monitor Network Defense Map for asset status visualization
8. Respond to real-time alerts in Alert Center
9. Manage security controls (firewall, endpoint, access control)
10. Utilize AI Threat Analysis for attack pattern recognition
11. Execute incident response procedures for security events
12. Practice terminal commands for defensive operations (status, scan, block, isolate)
13. Experience adaptive learning difficulty adjustments based on performance
14. Monitor 15-minute simulation timer and performance metrics
15. Receive real-time feedback on defensive decisions
16. Complete simulation with comprehensive scoring and performance analysis
17. Review final results including asset integrity, detection rate, and response effectiveness
18. Access performance recommendations for skill improvement
19. Experience session persistence and state recovery capabilities
20. Verify educational feedback enhances cybersecurity knowledge
21. Complete multiple sessions to experience AI learning adaptation
22. Verify comprehensive skill development in Blue Team defense, incident response, threat analysis, and real-time cybersecurity operations essential for SOC analyst and cybersecurity professional roles
